content:
We have a docs#Set.prod which is defined as { p | p.fst ∈ s ∧ p.snd ∈ t }

Do we have a dual Set.sum which is { p | p.fst ∈ s ∨ p.snd ∈ t }?

Context: I'm thinking about the union and intersection constructions for DFAs. We can define intersection as (M ⊓ M').accept = M.accept ×ˢ M'.accept. But I don't see a pithy definition for union.
Oh sorry, I see what you want. We don't have it as a standalone definition, because it's just Prod.fst ⁻¹' s ∪ Prod.snd ⁻¹' t
